page.title: 06ATTITUDES
page.content: Class 3 Juniors posted a questionnaire to each house in Oaks Rd. There were 26 houses on the north side of the road. We asked why they liked living in Tenterden and about their everyday lives. One large house had just been converted into an old peoples home and as building was still in progress we didn't collect much information from them. However we did discover that most people in the road were retired. Only two families had young children. Many had lived in Tenterden for over 10 years and thought it a very pleasant town with beautiful surroundings. Though they thought the amenities were good and they did a little shopping for odd items each day locally, many shopped at the big supermarkets in towns like Ashford or Hastings, perhaps about once a fortnight.
